title: Manzanita Cycles Whippet Gravel Bike
content:
From Reno, Nevada’s Manzanita Cycles comes a sporty production gravel bike model called the Whippet ($2,600 frameset). Find out more information below…

The Whippet is a fast and comfortable steel gravel bike with clearance for 2.25” wide tires. It is designed around a Seido MGV carbon fork with flat-mount brakes and cargo bosses. Its chassis is non-boost for a road q-factor, BB shell, and spacing.

Whippet Quick Hits

  • Made by owner Nick Jensen in Reno, NV
  • $2,600 for frameset
  • Frame is made from double-butted heat-treated chromoly steel
  • Seido MGV carbon fork, 12x100mm axle, 160/180mm flat mount, internal dynamo routing, low rider and 3-pack mounts
  • 12x142mm rear spacing
  • Flat mount 140mm/160mm rear brake
  • Clearance for 29×2.25″ (57×622) tires on sizes M4-M8
  • Clearance for 650bx2.25″ (57×584) tires on sizes M1-M3
  • 27.2mm seat post
  • Internal dropper post port
  • Integrated rear rack mounts
  • 3 bottle cage mounts, two inside the front triangle and one under the down tube
  • 68mm BSA bottom bracket shell
  • Wolf Tooth EC34/44 headset on sizes M3-M8
  • Wolf Tooth EC44/44 headset on sizes M1-M2
  • External cable routing using no zip-ties
  • Clearance for up to 42t 1x chainring
  • Clearance for cranks with a Q-factor of 150mm or greater

Geometry

The Manzanita Whippet comes in 8 sizes that should cover a wide spectrum of riders. Manzanita owner Nick Jensen is planning to make a batch of 8 frames for delivery in April. Now’s your chance to secure one of the first Whippets.

You can find a ton more info about the Whippet at Manzanita Cycles, including a link to place a deposit.
